message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CG. 

The paper deals with the performance of low-density parity-check codes under iterative decoding over a binary erasure channel, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also uses finite geometry in combinatorics to obtain BEC-optimal parity-check matrices, which falls under computational geometry (cs.CG). Additionally, the paper discusses stopping sets and stopping set distributions, which are related to the structure of the code and its parity-check matrix, and can be studied using graph theory and combinatorics (cs.CC, cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes an optimal decoder with lower decoding complexity, which is a topic in signal processing and machine learning (cs.SI).
